availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles R. West (Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, soldier)

body.p: Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Mustered in 20th Kentucky Infantry on May 24, 1963 in Louisville. Promoted from Sergeant to 1st Lieutenant on September 15, 1862. Promoted to Captain on February 7, 1863. Mustered in Captain of 20th Kentucky Infantry. Mustered out on January 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine, First Division.
Texas, Death Certificates, 1903-1982, Texas Department of State Health Services. Texas Death Certificates, 1903–1982. Austin, Texas, USA.
Register of Enlistments in the U.S. Army, 1798-1914, National Archives Microfilm Publication M233, Records of the Adjutant General’s Office, 1780’s-1917, Record Group 94, National Archives, Washington, D.C., p. 300.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 62, 955.
